oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Schools; Wooden buildings
Education - Tennessee; Education - History - Tennessee; School buildings - Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Simple wooden structure with four windows and one door visible. The building is located on an empty plot of land with grass and a few trees in the background.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Education Schoolhouse Photos, 1938-1942
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Britton Lane was a school for African American students. The school had one classroom and thirty-two students in 1939. Enola Bond was the principal and sole teacher. She taught grades 1 through 8.
